t: Mark 7
Followers of Tradition
The*p Pharisees and some of the scribes gathered around Him when they had come from Jerusalem,
and had seen that some of His disciples were eating their bread with impure hands, that is, unwashed.
(For the Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they carefully wash their hands, thus*i observing the traditions of the elders;

and when*i they*i come*i from the market place, they do not eat unless they cleanse themselves; and there are many other things which they have received in order to observe, such as the washing of cups and pitchers and copper pots.)
The Pharisees and the scribes asked Him, “Why do Your disciples not walk according to the tradition of the elders, but eat their bread with impure hands?”

And He said to them, “Rightly*r did*r Isaiah*r prophesy*r of*r you*r hypocrites,*r as*r it*r is*r written:*r ‘This*srpn people*sr honors*sr Me*sr with*sr their*sr lips,*sr But*srln their*sr heart*sr is*sr far*sr away*sr from*sr Me.*sr
But*srln in*sr vain*sr do*sr they*sr worship*sr Me,*sr Teaching*srln as*sr doctrines*sr the*sr precepts*sr of*sr men.’*sr
Neglecting*rp the*r commandment*r of*r God,*r you*r hold*r to*r the*r tradition*r of*r men.”*r
He*p was also saying to them, “You*r are*r experts*r at*r setting*r aside*r the*r commandment*r of*r God*r in*r order*r to*r keep*r your*r tradition.*r
For*r Moses*r said,*r ‘Honor*sr your*sr father*sr and*sr your*sr mother’;*sr and,*r ‘He*sr who*sr speaks*sr evil*sr of*sr father*sr or*sr mother,*sr is*sr to*sr be*sr put*sr to*sr death’;*sr
but*r you*r say,*r ‘If*r a*r man*r says*r to*r his*ir father*r or*r his*ir mother,*r whatever*r I*r have*r that*r would*r help*r you*r is*r Corban*r (that is to say, given to*i God),’*i
you*r no*r longer*r permit*r him*r to*r do*r anything*r for*r his*ir father*r or*r his*ir mother;*r
thus*ir invalidating*r the*r word*r of*r God*r by*r your*r tradition*r which*r you*r have*r handed*r down;*r and*r you*r do*r many*r things*r such*r as*r that.”*r
The Heart of Man
After*p He called the crowd to Him again, He began*i saying to them, “Listen*r to*r Me,*r all*r of*r you,*r and*r understand:*r

there*r is*r nothing*r outside*r the*r man*r which*r can*r defile*r him*r if*r it*r goes*r into*r him;*r but*r the*r things*r which*r proceed*r out*r of*r the*r man*r are*r what*r defile*r the*r man.*r
[If*r anyone*r has*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear.”]*r
When*p he had left the crowd and*i entered the house, His disciples questioned Him about the parable.
And He said to them, “Are*r you*r so*r lacking*r in*r understanding*r also?*r Do*r you*r not*r understand*r that*r whatever*r goes*r into*r the*r man*r from*r outside*r cannot*r defile*r him,*r
because*r it*r does*r not*r go*r into*r his*r heart,*r but*r into*r his*r stomach,*r and*r is*r eliminated?”*r (Thus*i He*i declared all foods clean.)
And He was saying, “That*r which*r proceeds*r out*r of*r the*r man,*r that*r is*r what*r defiles*r the*r man.*r
For*r from*r within,*r out*r of*r the*r heart*r of*r men,*r proceed*r the*r evil*r thoughts,*r fornications,*r thefts,*r murders,*r adulteries,*r
deeds*r of*r coveting*r and*ir wickedness,*r as*ir well*ir as*ir deceit,*r sensuality,*r envy,*r slander,*r pride*r and*ir foolishness.*r
All*r these*r evil*r things*r proceed*r from*r within*r and*r defile*r the*r man.”*r
The Syrophoenician Woman
Jesus*p got up and went away from there to the region of Tyre. And when He had entered a house, He wanted no one to know of*i it;*i yet He could not escape notice.
But after hearing of Him, a woman whose little daughter had an unclean spirit immediately came and fell at His feet.
Now the woman was a Gentile, of the Syrophoenician race. And she kept asking Him to cast the demon out of her daughter.
And He was saying to her, “Let*r the*r children*r be*r satisfied*r first,*r for*r it*r is*r not*r good*r to*r take*r the*r children’s*r bread*r and*r throw*r it*r to*r the*r dogs.”*r
But she answered and said to Him, “Yes, Lord, but*i even the dogs under the table feed on the children’s crumbs.”
And He said to her, “Because*r of*r this*r answer*r go;*r the*r demon*r has*r gone*r out*r of*r your*r daughter.”*r
And going back to her home, she found the child lying on the bed, the demon having left.
Again*p He went out from the region of Tyre, and came through Sidon to the Sea of Galilee, within the region of Decapolis.
They brought to Him one who was deaf and spoke with difficulty, and they implored Him to lay His hand on him.
Jesus took him aside from the crowd, by himself, and put His fingers into his ears, and after spitting, He touched his tongue with*i the*i saliva;*i
and looking up to heaven with a deep sigh, He said to him, “Ephphatha!”*r that is, “Be*r opened!”*r
And his ears were opened, and the impediment of his tongue was removed, and he began*i speaking plainly.
And He gave them orders not to tell anyone; but the more He ordered them, the more widely they continued to proclaim it.
They were utterly astonished, saying, “He has done all things well; He makes even the deaf to hear and the mute to speak.”
